data.text: I’m not saying I’m okay at all with Spacy’s conduct. But I believe there’s a proper way to deal with the situation where everyone could have been happy. Spacey was going to be gone from the show anyways, what would a few more episodes hurt? The damage was already done.

Doesn’t mean I agree with it. But I will never be a person that allows personal opinion or outside life tv affect what happens on screen or on the page. And not that I think I need to but just in case I do...

But as a fan, I’m not gonna lie. If Netflix doesn’t nail next season with how they deal with Frank’s absent - I’m going to be very vocal. Beyond anything else, I’m an artist. A storyteller. I couldn’t give 2 shits what someone does behind closed doors.

Netflix couldn’t have dedicated a single episode. 1, perhaps the very first episode of House of Cards to give such an iconic character a proper ending. It’s not that I have an issue with Claire Underwood taking the helm. I think things would have been heading that way anyways.

I have never agreed with how Netflix has chosen to deal with the shows after Spacey’s personal life has come out into the open. While I realize that the life of an individual, and even multiple individuals are way more important than a tv show, I find it hard to believe that
